RetryPolicy RetryPolicy Class

Definition

Namespace:
Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling
Assembly:
Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.NetStandard.dll

Provides the base implementation of the retry mechanism for unreliable actions and transient conditions.

The ITransientErrorDetectionStrategy that is responsible for detecting transient conditions.

The strategy to use for this retry policy.

Edit

Initializes a new instance of the RetryPolicy class with the specified number of retry attempts and parameters defining the progressive delay between retries.

public RetryPolicy(ITransientErrorDetectionStrategy errorDetectionStrategy, int retryCount, TimeSpan initialInterval, TimeSpan increment)Public Sub New(errorDetectionStrategy As ITransientErrorDetectionStrategy, retryCount As Integer, initialInterval As TimeSpan, increment As TimeSpan)
Parameters
errorDetectionStrategy
ITransientErrorDetectionStrategy ITransientErrorDetectionStrategy

The ITransientErrorDetectionStrategy that is responsible for detecting transient conditions.

retryCount
Int32 Int32

The number of retry attempts.

initialInterval
TimeSpan TimeSpan

The initial interval that will apply for the first retry.

increment
TimeSpan TimeSpan

The incremental time value that will be used to calculate the progressive delay between retries.

RetryPolicy(ITransientErrorDetectionStrategy, Int32, TimeSpan, TimeSpan, TimeSpan) RetryPolicy(ITransientErrorDetectionStrategy, Int32, TimeSpan, TimeSpan, TimeSpan)

Edit

Initializes a new instance of the RetryPolicy class with the specified number of retry attempts and backoff parameters for calculating the exponential delay between retries.

public RetryPolicy(ITransientErrorDetectionStrategy errorDetectionStrategy, int retryCount, TimeSpan minBackoff, TimeSpan maxBackoff, TimeSpan deltaBackoff)Public Sub New(errorDetectionStrategy As ITransientErrorDetectionStrategy, retryCount As Integer, minBackoff As TimeSpan, maxBackoff As TimeSpan, deltaBackoff As TimeSpan)
Parameters
errorDetectionStrategy
ITransientErrorDetectionStrategy ITransientErrorDetectionStrategy

The ITransientErrorDetectionStrategy that is responsible for detecting transient conditions.

retryCount
Int32 Int32

The number of retry attempts.

minBackoff
TimeSpan TimeSpan

The minimum backoff time.

maxBackoff
TimeSpan TimeSpan

The maximum backoff time.

deltaBackoff
TimeSpan TimeSpan

The time value that will be used to calculate a random delta in the exponential delay between retries.

Properties

DefaultExponential DefaultExponential

Edit

Returns a default policy that implements a random exponential retry interval configured with the default FixedInterval retry strategy. The default retry policy treats all caught exceptions as transient errors.

public static RetryPolicy DefaultExponential { get; }Public Shared ReadOnly Property DefaultExponential As RetryPolicy
Value
RetryPolicy RetryPolicy

DefaultFixed DefaultFixed

Edit

Returns a default policy that implements a fixed retry interval configured with the default FixedInterval retry strategy. The default retry policy treats all caught exceptions as transient errors.

public static RetryPolicy DefaultFixed { get; }Public Shared ReadOnly Property DefaultFixed As RetryPolicy
Value
RetryPolicy RetryPolicy

DefaultProgressive DefaultProgressive

Edit

Returns a default policy that implements a progressive retry interval configured with the default Incremental retry strategy. The default retry policy treats all caught exceptions as transient errors.

public static RetryPolicy DefaultProgressive { get; }Public Shared ReadOnly Property DefaultProgressive As RetryPolicy
Value
RetryPolicy RetryPolicy

ErrorDetectionStrategy ErrorDetectionStrategy

Edit

Gets the instance of the error detection strategy.

public ITransientErrorDetectionStrategy ErrorDetectionStrategy { get; }Public ReadOnly Property ErrorDetectionStrategy As ITransientErrorDetectionStrategy
Value
ITransientErrorDetectionStrategy ITransientErrorDetectionStrategy

NoRetry NoRetry

Edit

Returns a default policy that performs no retries, but invokes the action only once.

public static RetryPolicy NoRetry { get; }Public Shared ReadOnly Property NoRetry As RetryPolicy
Value
RetryPolicy RetryPolicy

RetryStrategy RetryStrategy

Edit

Gets the retry strategy.

public RetryStrategy RetryStrategy { get; }Public ReadOnly Property RetryStrategy As RetryStrategy
Value
RetryStrategy RetryStrategy

Methods

ExecuteAction(Action) ExecuteAction(Action)

Edit

Repetitively executes the specified action while it satisfies the current retry policy.

public virtual void ExecuteAction(Action action)Public Overridable Sub ExecuteAction(action As Action)
Parameters
action
Action Action

A delegate that represents the executable action that doesn't return any results.

ExecuteAction<TResult>(Func<TResult>) ExecuteAction(Of TResult)(Func(Of TResult))

Edit

Repetitively executes the specified action while it satisfies the current retry policy.

public virtual TResult ExecuteAction<TResult>(Func<TResult> func)Public Overridable Function ExecuteAction(Of TResult)(func As Func(Of TResult)) As TResult
Parameters
func
Func<TResult> Func(Of TResult)

A delegate that represents the executable action that returns the result of type TResult.

Returns
TResult TResult

The result from the action.

ExecuteAsync(Func<Task>) ExecuteAsync(Func(Of Task))

Edit

Repetitively executes the specified asynchronous task while it satisfies the current retry policy.

public Task ExecuteAsync(Func<Task> taskAction)Public Function ExecuteAsync(taskAction As Func(Of Task)) As Task
Parameters
taskAction
Func<Task> Func(Of Task)

A function that returns a started task (also known as "hot" task).

Returns
Task Task

A task that will run to completion if the original task completes successfully (either the first time or after retrying transient failures). If the task fails with a non-transient error or the retry limit is reached, the returned task will transition to a faulted state and the exception must be observed.

ExecuteAsync(Func<Task>, CancellationToken) ExecuteAsync(Func(Of Task), CancellationToken)

Edit

Repetitively executes the specified asynchronous task while it satisfies the current retry policy.

public Task ExecuteAsync(Func<Task> taskAction, CancellationToken cancellationToken)Public Function ExecuteAsync(taskAction As Func(Of Task), cancellationToken As CancellationToken) As Task
Parameters
taskAction
Func<Task> Func(Of Task)

A function that returns a started task (also known as "hot" task).

cancellationToken
CancellationToken CancellationToken

The token used to cancel the retry operation. This token does not cancel the execution of the asynchronous task.

Returns
Task Task

Returns a task that will run to completion if the original task completes successfully (either the first time or after retrying transient failures). If the task fails with a non-transient error or the retry limit is reached, the returned task will transition to a faulted state and the exception must be observed.

ExecuteAsync<TResult>(Func<Task<TResult>>) ExecuteAsync(Of TResult)(Func(Of Task(Of TResult)))

Edit

Repeatedly executes the specified asynchronous task while it satisfies the current retry policy.

public Task<TResult> ExecuteAsync<TResult>(Func<Task<TResult>> taskFunc)Public Function ExecuteAsync(Of TResult)(taskFunc As Func(Of Task(Of TResult))) As Task(Of TResult)
Parameters
taskFunc
Func<Task<TResult>> Func(Of Task(Of TResult))

A function that returns a started task (also known as "hot" task).

Returns
Task<TResult> Task(Of TResult)

Returns a task that will run to completion if the original task completes successfully (either the first time or after retrying transient failures). If the task fails with a non-transient error or the retry limit is reached, the returned task will transition to a faulted state and the exception must be observed.

ExecuteAsync<TResult>(Func<Task<TResult>>, CancellationToken) ExecuteAsync(Of TResult)(Func(Of Task(Of TResult)), CancellationToken)

Edit

Repeatedly executes the specified asynchronous task while it satisfies the current retry policy.

public Task<TResult> ExecuteAsync<TResult>(Func<Task<TResult>> taskFunc, CancellationToken cancellationToken)Public Function ExecuteAsync(Of TResult)(taskFunc As Func(Of Task(Of TResult)), cancellationToken As CancellationToken) As Task(Of TResult)
Parameters
taskFunc
Func<Task<TResult>> Func(Of Task(Of TResult))

A function that returns a started task (also known as "hot" task).

cancellationToken
CancellationToken CancellationToken

The token used to cancel the retry operation. This token does not cancel the execution of the asynchronous task.

Returns
Task<TResult> Task(Of TResult)

Returns a task that will run to completion if the original task completes successfully (either the first time or after retrying transient failures). If the task fails with a non-transient error or the retry limit is reached, the returned task will transition to a faulted state and the exception must be observed.

OnRetrying(Int32, Exception, TimeSpan) OnRetrying(Int32, Exception, TimeSpan)

Edit

Notifies the subscribers whenever a retry condition is encountered.

protected virtual void OnRetrying(int retryCount, Exception lastError, TimeSpan delay)Protected Overridable Sub OnRetrying(retryCount As Integer, lastError As Exception, delay As TimeSpan)
Parameters
retryCount
Int32 Int32

The current retry attempt count.

lastError
Exception Exception

The exception that caused the retry conditions to occur.

delay
TimeSpan TimeSpan

The delay that indicates how long the current thread will be suspended before the next iteration is invoked.

Events

Retrying Retrying

Edit

An instance of a callback delegate that will be invoked whenever a retry condition is encountered.

public event EventHandler<RetryingEventArgs> RetryingPublic Event Retrying As EventHandler(Of RetryingEventArgs)
